qas.question: The formation of which mountain range was the result of of what zone along the Pacific Ocean side of South America?
Which continent was India colliding with in the Miocene?
When Africa was colliding with Eurasia which seaway ceased to be during the Miocene?
Between what period of time did the Tethys disappear?
Which crisis occured towards the end of the Miocene period?

plausible_answers.text: land bridge between South America and North America

qas.question: What bridge was present during the Miocene?
What seaway opened as Africa collided with Eurasia?
When did the Tethys Seaway open?
What caused rain to increase in the Mediterranean

context: During the Miocene continents continued to drift toward their present positions. Of the modern geologic features, only the <b5_0>land bridge between South America and North America<b5_0/> was absent, the subduction zone along the Pacific Ocean margin of South America caused the rise of <a0_0>the Andes<a0_0/> and the southward extension of the Meso-American peninsula. India continued to collide with <a1_0>Asia<a1_0/>. <a2_0><b6_0>The Tethys Seaway<b6_0/><a2_0/> continued to shrink and then disappeared as Africa collided with Eurasia in the Turkish-Arabian region between <a3_0><b7_0>19 and 12 Ma<b7_0/><a3_0/> (ICS 2004). Subsequent <b8_0>uplift of mountains<b8_0/> in the western Mediterranean region and a global fall in sea levels combined to cause a temporary drying up of the Mediterranean Sea resulting in the <a4_0>Messinian salinity crisis<a4_0/> near the end of the Miocene.
